text: [Music]
I'm Kisha W I work as a technical
product manager my name is s Ray I'm a
product manager in e-commerce
[Music]
Tech I did my bachelor's in engineering
but I didn't do anything like product
management and that right my experience
it was based on like whatever made sense
logically as I started getting into
building uh processes as product road
maps I I was more inclined towards
building something from scratch so I
decided to take this course what
motivated me to pursue this course was
the fact that it would give me a lot of
structure and Alignment to whatever I'm
already
doing I always wanted to take the cohort
version because the collaborative part
where we get to talk to coaches get to
talk to our peers and there is a group
interaction is what makes me more lively
and connected to the course as well as
apply those learnings like how would you
conduct user interviews or how would you
plan plan out the entire user journey
and how do you identify the real
problems that you need to solve it also
captured real life constant feedback
from our coaches who gave us a real life
product problem to develop from
inception till the product roll
out every assignment that we were given
contributed to one product artifact for
our end product so that just gave me an
opportunity to learn the concept and
immediately go and apply it to something
I have like applied some of the
learnings in the product I was able to
go back and really test the waters there
that we are actually going in the right
direction and then go and present it in
front of people professors from Stanford
who would question you who would ask you
things and force you to think beyond
your uh you know regular day-to-day
imagination I felt the maximum value
came from people you know who had
certain years of Industry experience
because that uh sparked a lot of good
ideas and discussions this course had
building blocks which touched every
aspect so I would definitely recommend
this to anybody who is wanting to take a
leap in product space
